oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Oath of allegiance
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pvt. John H. Thompson, Co. F, 20th Tenn. Cav., CSA, of Henry County, Tenn. took this oath of allegiance after the war ended. It describes him as 5'11" tall, with a fair complexion, brown hair and hazel eyes. His service record indicates that he served in Co. K, and that he was reported as absentee or deserter in Verona, Miss. in Feb. 1865. This regiment was part of Col. Tyree Bell's brigade under Gen. Nathan B. Forrest. Thompson was wounded at the Battle of Harrisburg, Miss. in July 1864.
